summary:
24. Underscores the importance of updating the military concept of operations and rules of engagement.

25. Requests UNOCI to contribute to the promotion and protection of human rights, with special attention to violence against children and women.

26. Requests the Secretary-General to ensure full compliance with the UN zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuses.

27. Requests the Secretary-General to keep the Council informed, at least every three months, of the situation on the ground.

28. Requests the Secretary-General to provide updates on a strategic workplan with indicative timelines to measure progress on benchmarks.

29. Intends to review by 31 July 2009 the mandates of UNOCI and the French forces, troop levels, and benchmarks.

30. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
